intro: Hillia ulei, commonly known as the Mexican hillia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in well-drained environments. It is a perennial herb that produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in the spring. Hillia ulei is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
